decisionmakingagent

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • decisionmakingagent.Agent

  • public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    To understand this class it is vital to understand the use of the two wrapper classes it works closely with, PotentialChar and PotentialWord. The flow through the program goes as follows:

    The driver passes an array of PotentialChar objects to the method assess. There should be one PotentialChar object for every letter in the word that is being assessed, with the contents of each PotentialChar being the array of Neurons that wordListed from the neural network processing the image associated with that character.

    The array of PotentialChars is then passed to the genCombos method to generate an ArrayList of PotentialWords. Each of these potential words is once again just an array of Neurons. This time, however, instead of a number of Neurons representing the top candidates for one specific letter, each the list of Neurons spells out a word that can be formed out of the list of letters.

    Each word in the ArrayList is then scored based on two criteria: the frequency of use and the cumulative probability of all of its letters.

    Author:
    Nathan Van Dyken, Sulman Qureshi

    • Method Detail

      • assess

        public java.lang.String assess(PotentialChar[] newWord)
        Given the output of the NN, generates and returns the word that is most likely the one composed of all the potential letters.
        Parameters:
        newWord - - the letters from the NN that need to be evaluated to produce one word.
        Returns:
        the best fit for the letters that were passed. See the class documentation for further explanation.

      • scoreByLexicon

        void scoreByLexicon()
        Scores each potential word with a score based on its frequency of use as stored in the Lexicon database. Generates new words if one or more of the letters in the word have a probability that is below the constant UNKNOWN_LETTER_CUTOFF.

      • scoreByProbability

        java.util.ArrayList<PotentialWord> scoreByProbability(java.util.ArrayList<PotentialWord> combos)
        This method takes a type potentialWord arrayList which contains all possible word combinations. Then for each word possibility it calculates a averageScore that will represent the words likeliness.
        Parameters:
        combos - - the ArrayList which holds all combinations of words.
        Returns:
        - returns combo arrayList with updated averageScore for each word in the array.

      • makeFinalDecision

        public java.lang.String makeFinalDecision()
        Simply scores every word and returns the word with the highest score.
        Returns:
        the word that is the best fit for all the letters passed to the decision making agent.
